scenario.title: Feedback on Project Communication (User has Low Clarity and Structure)
scenario.description: An Assistant (playing a direct report, Sam) asks for specific feedback, but the User (playing a manager) responds with vague corporate jargon and lacks a clear, structured message.

transcript.speaker: Assistant
transcript.message: Hi, thanks for meeting. You mentioned you had some feedback for me about the Phoenix project?

transcript.speaker: User
transcript.message: Hey. Yeah, so, about that... we need to leverage our synergies better. The deliverables aren't aligning with our core competencies right now.

transcript.speaker: Assistant
transcript.message: Okay, I appreciate that perspective. Could you give me a specific example of a deliverable that I worked on where you see a misalignment? That would help me understand better.

transcript.speaker: User
transcript.message: It's about the bigger picture. The holistic view. We need to operationalize our key learnings and pivot our strategy to be more results-oriented. It's a paradigm shift.

transcript.speaker: Assistant
transcript.message: I see. I'm trying to translate that into concrete actions for myself. For instance, regarding the Q3 report I submitted, was there a specific part that you felt missed the mark or needed to be more results-oriented?

transcript.speaker: User
transcript.message: It's not about one report, it's about the whole... process. We need to streamline the value-add and minimize the friction points. Just be more proactive.

transcript.speaker: Assistant
transcript.message: Okay, 'be more proactive' is something I can work with. Would it be helpful, for example, if I sent a daily summary of my progress to increase transparency?

transcript.speaker: User
transcript.message: Let's blue-sky that offline. Just keep pushing the envelope. We'll circle back.
